operational and telemetry information in the packet while the packet operational and telemetry information in the packet while the packet
traverses a path between two points in the network. This document traverses a path between two points in the network. This document
discusses the data types and data formats for in-band OAM data discusses the data types and data formats for in-band OAM data
records. In-band OAM data records can be embedded into a variety of records. In-band OAM data records can be embedded into a variety of
transports such as NSH, Segment Routing, VXLAN-GPE, native IPv6 (via transports such as NSH, Segment Routing, VXLAN-GPE, native IPv6 (via
extension header), or IPv4. In-band OAM is to complement current extension header), or IPv4. In-band OAM is to complement current

1. Introduction 1. Introduction
This document defines data record types for "in-band" operation, This document defines data record types for "in-band" operation,
administration, and maintenance (OAM). In-band OAM records OAM administration, and maintenance (OAM). In-band OAM records OAM
information within the packet while the packet traverses a particular information within the packet while the packet traverses a particular
network domain. The term "in-band" refers to the fact that the OAM network domain. The term "in-band" refers to the fact that the OAM
data is added to the data packets rather than is being sent within data is added to the data packets rather than is being sent within
packets specifically dedicated to OAM. A discussion of the packets specifically dedicated to OAM. A discussion of the
motivation and requirements for in-band OAM can be found in motivation and requirements for in-band OAM can be found in
[draft-brockners-inband-oam-requirements]. In-band OAM is to [I-D.brockners-inband-oam-requirements]. In-band OAM is to
complement "out-of-band" or "active" mechanisms such as ping or complement "out-of-band" or "active" mechanisms such as ping or
traceroute, or more recent active probing mechanisms as described in traceroute, or more recent active probing mechanisms as described in
[I-D.lapukhov-dataplane-probe]. In-band OAM mechanisms can be [I-D.lapukhov-dataplane-probe]. In-band OAM mechanisms can be
leveraged where current out-of-band mechanisms do not apply or do not leveraged where current out-of-band mechanisms do not apply or do not
offer the desired results, such as proving that a certain set of offer the desired results, such as proving that a certain set of
traffic takes a pre-defined path, SLA verification for the live data traffic takes a pre-defined path, SLA verification for the live data
traffic, detailed statistics on traffic distribution paths in traffic, detailed statistics on traffic distribution paths in
networks that distribute traffic across multiple paths, or scenarios networks that distribute traffic across multiple paths, or scenarios
where probe traffic is potentially handled differently from regular where probe traffic is potentially handled differently from regular
data traffic by the network devices. data traffic by the network devices.

3. In-band OAM Data Types and Data Format 3. In-band OAM Data Types and Data Format
This section defines in-band OAM data types and data formats of the This section defines in-band OAM data types and data formats of the
data records required for in-band OAM. The different uses of in-band data records required for in-band OAM. The different uses of in-band
OAM require the definition of different types of data. The in-band OAM require the definition of different types of data. The in-band
OAM data format for the data being carried corresponds to the three OAM data format for the data being carried corresponds to the three
main categories of in-band OAM data defined in main categories of in-band OAM data defined in
[draft-brockners-inband-oam-requirements], which are edge-to-edge, [I-D.brockners-inband-oam-requirements], which are edge-to-edge, per
per node, and for selected nodes only. node, and for selected nodes only.
Transport options for in-band OAM data are found in Transport options for in-band OAM data are found in
[draft-brockners-inband-oam-transport]. In-band OAM data is defined [I-D.brockners-inband-oam-transport]. In-band OAM data is defined as
as options in Type-Length-Value (TLV) format. The TLV format for options in Type-Length-Value (TLV) format. The TLV format for each
each of the three different types of in-band OAM data is defined in of the three different types of in-band OAM data is defined in this
this document. document.

than on the overall Internet. The part of the network which employs than on the overall Internet. The part of the network which employs
in-band OAM is referred to as "in-band OAM-domain". In-band OAM data in-band OAM is referred to as "in-band OAM-domain". In-band OAM data
is added to a packet on entering the in-band OAM-domain and is is added to a packet on entering the in-band OAM-domain and is
removed from the packet when exiting the domain. Within the in-band removed from the packet when exiting the domain. Within the in-band
